samples.context: Kate and Mark want to learn a new language. If Kate studies French daily, she'll become fluent. If Mark gets a job in Germany, he'll learn German fluently. Either Kate will study French, or Mark gets a job in Germany, or both. If Mark learns German, he can converse with colleagues.
samples.question: If Kate did not become fluent in French, could Mark converse with his German colleagues?

samples.context: Jessica and Justin are preparing for an upcoming spelling bee. If Jessica trains hard, she will win the spelling bee. If Justin gets sick, he will have to miss the spelling bee. Either Jessica will train, or Justin will get sick, or both. If Justin misses the spelling bee, he cannot win.
samples.question: If Jessica did not win the spelling bee, did Justin fail to win the spelling bee?

samples.context: Ashley wants to become a better interior designer. If she takes interior design courses, she'll learn new decorating techniques. Also, if Ashley redoes her living room, she can experiment with different room layouts. Ashley decides to either take design courses, or redo her living room, or do both. She knows that if she experiments with layouts, she'll find a furniture arrangement she loves.
samples.question: If Ashley did not learn new decorating techniques, did she find a furniture arrangement she loved?

samples.context: Julia wants to advance her piano skills. If she takes piano lessons, she will learn to play more complex pieces. Also, if Julia practices the piano every day, her skills will improve. Julia decides to either take piano lessons, or practice daily, or do both. She knows that if her skills improve, she will gain more confidence in her abilities.
samples.question: If Julia did not learn to play complex pieces, did she gain confidence in her abilities?

samples.context: Emily wants to learn piano. If she takes lessons, Emily will learn how to read music. Also, if Emily practices piano daily, her skills will improve. Emily decides to either take lessons, or practice daily, or do both. If her skills improve, Emily will gain the confidence to perform for others.
samples.question: If Emily did not learn how to read music, did she gain confidence to perform?

samples.context: Ashley feels isolated these days. If she adopts a dog from a shelter, she'll gain a companion. Also, if she joins a hiking group, Ashley will make new friends. Ashley decides to either adopt a dog, join a hiking group, or do both. She knows making friends will help her feel less isolated.
samples.question: If Ashley did not gain a companion, did she feel less isolated?

samples.context: Ashley wants to expand her worldview. If she learns Spanish, she'll become fluent. Also, if she studies abroad in Spain, she'll gain an appreciation for other cultures. Ashley decides to either learn Spanish, study abroad, or both. She knows that if she gains cultural appreciation, she'll become more open-minded.
samples.question: If Ashley did not become fluent in Spanish, did she become more open-minded?

samples.context: Mary has a very important exam coming up. If she studies hard, she will pass the exam. However, it might be a very difficult exam. If the exam is very hard, then many students will likely fail it. Mary knows that either she will study hard, or the exam will be really difficult, or maybe both. If many students fail the tough exam, then the teacher will curve the grades.
samples.question: If Mary did not pass the exam, did the teacher curve the grades?

samples.context: Jessica wants to gain confidence in her music skills. If she practices piano daily, her piano skills will improve. Also, if Jessica joins a band, she'll gain experience performing live. Jessica decides to either practice piano daily, join a band, or do both. She knows that if she gains performing experience, she'll become confident playing live.
samples.question: If Jessica did not improve her piano skills, did she become confident playing live?

samples.context: Mark wants to improve his fitness level. If he starts a new workout routine, he will become more fit. However, Mark also loves eating junk food. If he eats more junk food, he will gain weight. Mark decides he will either start a workout routine or eat more junk food, or maybe do both. If he gains weight, his health will start to decline.
samples.question: If Mark did not become more fit, did his health decline?

samples.context: Matt wants to learn woodworking. If he takes it up, Matt will learn carpentry skills. Also, if Matt watches DIY tutorials, he'll feel able to do small renovations. Matt will either learn woodworking, watch tutorials, or both. If Matt feels capable with renovations, he will feel more self-reliant overall.
samples.question: If Matt did not learn carpentry skills, did he feel self-reliant?

samples.context: Mike wants to improve his health. If he goes to the gym every morning, he'll gain strength and energy. Also, if he eats a healthy plant-based diet, his cholesterol level will drop. Mike decides to either go to the gym, or eat healthy, or do both. He knows that if his cholesterol drops, his risk of heart disease will decrease.
samples.question: If Mike did not gain strength and energy, did his risk of heart disease decrease?

samples.context: Hannah wants to complete a marathon. If she trains by running long distances, her endurance will improve. Also, if Hannah does strength training, she will get stronger physically. Hannah decides to either train by running, do strength training, or do both. She knows that getting stronger will help her successfully complete the marathon.
samples.question: If Hannah did not improve her running endurance, did she complete the marathon?
